Comments_List: Understanding of business and environment issues
Thinking creatively about a problem, thinking about levers of change & change agents, developing a business plan

I thought there would be more structure to the class and more formal learning about the different wicked challenges, but I'm actually glad my expectations weren't met. What I gained from this class ended up being more valuable to me.
More practical tools for business and the environment

Strengths: guest speakers (esp. Peter Boyd, Dan Gross), ideation & reframing & archetyping sessions

Weaknesses: Roger Ibbottson's lecture, which didn't really add any value

Even if none of the challenges are directly related to the topics you're focusing on here at Yale, I still recommend taking this class to help you think through problems at the intersection of business & the environment. It'll give you the opportunity to think creatively about problems and come up with innovative solutions, which is not something you get to do in many other courses.
